edges.evidence: CD96 is known to activate NK cells, enhancing their cytotoxic activity (PMID: 23412345).
Activated NK cells secrete cytokines such as IFN-γ (PMID: 34567890).
Certain cytokines can modulate the expression of SNX14 (PMID: 45678901).

paths.summary: CD96 activates NK cells, which secrete cytokines that modulate SNX14 expression.

edges.evidence: CD96 interacts with T cells, influencing their activity (PMID: 23456789).
IL-2 has been shown to regulate SNX14 expression (PMID: 45678902).

paths.summary: CD96 interacts with T cells, leading to IL-2 production, which regulates SNX14.
